Description: Bust of Constantine I, draped, cuirassed, head, with rosette-diadem, right. (obverse)
Victory, winged, draped, advancing left, holding trophy, vertical, in right hand and palm, vertical, in left. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Bibliographic references: RIC7 / The Roman Imperial Coinage, vol. 7: Constantine and Licinius AD 313-337 (93, p.694) (type)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015-2016 29 Oct–7 Feb, London, BM, G35, Egypt: faith after the pharaohs.
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Constantine the Great
